summary: This bill, titled "No Tax Dollars for Riots," aims to prevent federal funds from going to non-profit entities if their officers or board members are convicted of certain offenses (specifically those related to rioting under US Code Title 18, sections 111 & 2101). It also stipulates that such entities would lose their tax-exempt status under section 501 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 if these offenses are committed. The bill was introduced by Mr. Kiley of California.
